Tbh I miss old Fiora, even though Blade Waltz was cancer, and I hate that I can't play Fiora anymore. The fact she has max hp % in ***true*** damage is stupid. It should be physical, with Grand Challenge switching Vitals to True Damage, and *only* during Grand Challenge. Otherwise, her passive shouldn't give her easy access to extra damage that cannot be countered by any means.

What counterplay does Fiora have? 

* Well, first off, you can reset her passive to a more favorable position, which makes it hard for her to Q it without putting herself at risk.

* Secondly, she's VERY squishy. So if you go all in on her (not when she pops her ult, of course) you can just overpower her.

* She has no hard CC unless you throw a stun at her parry. 

* She has incredibly short range (hello, Gnar!)

Now, as to which champs counter her? Jayce, Gnar, Heimer, Mundo, Darius, Teemo, Quinn... see the pattern? Anyone who can blind, keep her at range, go all in with overpowering damage, or any combination, can easily deal with Fiora. She's not as broken as people like to make her out to be. Is she strong? Definitely. Is she without counterplay? Not at all. She excels at dueling, and can take on most people 1v1, and she can annihilate squishies with relative ease -- tanks can fight her for a while, but if she pops her ult, you better run.

Every champion can be counterplayed, and (almost) every champion has weaknesses (looking at you, Riven, Vayne and so on).
Given that she absolutely dominated the lane against a _Gnar_, I think you should go ahead and rethink your conclusions.
Bad Gnar vs. good Fiora would mean a Fiora won lane. What's your point? :P

If the instant she pops her ult you have lost then there might be something wrong with the champion.  There is the idea of just running away when she uses it, but she gets a 30% minimum move speed boost just for being in the duel area.  Combine that with her dash and there really doesn't feel like there is a viable escape.

I seem to recall that there was something said along the lines of "anyone should be able to outplay Fiora" in the rework page.  I may be wrong but that statement sure as salt is too.  Most low mobility champs have jack crap they can do to stop a Fiora from killing them in any situation.

Well, given that it takes her a good 3-4s to pop every vital, you can get out fast enough since most immobile champs have some form of CC. And 99.99% of the population runs flash. If not, there are things called QSS, merc sword, Zhonya's and so on available to you. :P

I will admit that, numbers-wise, she's a little high (I think capping her passive to, say, 10-12.5% (40% and 50% max HP with ult) would be a good idea. But her kit definitely has counterplay available.

A lot of them do have cc, but it has a tendency to be delayed a little.  Using delayed cc against a Fiora is just a good way to kill yourself.  Considering that 99% of the population uses flash you might expect the Fiora to also have flash, so you will die anyway.  QSS and Zhonya's are not options that are good on a lot of people, and Zhonya's is probably a poor choice against Fiora anyway (unless you are in a teamfight situation and you are an APC).  Outside of QSS there is no items that are good against her aside from maybe Rylai's, Randuin's and Twin Shadows because slows are always nice.

There is some counterplay to her.  Do I think that there are a lot of champs that can't take advantage of said counterplay?  Yes.  I understand that there is such a thing as counterpicks, but it feels like Fiora is a hard counter to more champs than is reasonable.  I don't know if reducing her numbers will make it so those champs can use her counterplay but it can't hurt.
